sorcer.service
Interface Signature

All Superinterfaces:
Parameter, Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
EvaluationSignature, NetSignature, ObjectSignature, ServiceSignature
public interface Signature
extends Serializable, Parameter

A service Signature is an indirect behavioral feature of Exertions that declares a service that can be performed by instances of Services. It contains a service type and a selector of operation of that service type (interface). Its implicit parameter and return value is a service Context. Thus, the explicit signature of service-oriented operations is defined by the same Context type for any exertion parameter and return value . A signature may include a collection of optional attributes describing a preferred Service with a given service type. Also a signature can carry own implementation when its type is implemented with the provided codebase.

In other words, a service signature is a specification of a service that can be requested dynamically at the boundary of a service provider. Operations include modifying a service Context or disclosing information about the service dataContext.

Author:
Mike Sobolewski

static class Signature.Type
          There are four types of Signature operations that can be associated with signatures: PREPROCESS, PROCESS , POSTPROCESS, and APPEND signature.

String getCodebase()
Returns a codebase for the code implementing this signature. The codebase is a space separated string (list) of URls.
